Package org.berthold.beamCalc

Class BeamSolver

java.lang.Object
org.berthold.beamCalc.BeamSolver
public class BeamSolver
extends java.lang.Object
Solves a simply supported beam with single and/ or line loads. Beam has a statically determined support configuration. supports may be placed arbitrary. Solver has to check for valid initial conditions. If any of the expected initial conditions are not met (e.g. support not inside beam length) result is set to 0 and an Error object is added to Result object. Vertical Forces: Force, leading sign: (+) Force acts upwards (-) Force acts downwards. Horizontal Forces: Force acts from right to left (+), force acts from left to right (-) Torque, leading sign (+) Clockwise. (-) Anti- clockwise.

Single loads may act in an arbitrary angle. Line loads may only act downwards or upwards. Angle for those loads will be ignored.

Solver calculates from left to right by solving the following equation:

TorqueSumAtRightsupport=0=F_Leftxl-F1x(l2-x1)-F2x(l2-x2)-....-Fn(l2-xn)

Resulting force at right support is calculated by solving this equation:

SummOfVerticalForces=0=F_Left-F1-F2-....-Fn+F_Right

Author:
Berthold

      public static BeamResult getResults​(Beam beam, java.lang.String floatFormat)
      Creates a new result.
      Parameters:
      beam - A simply supported Beam with two Support's and at least one Load
      floatFormat - Float Format. Determines the decimal places used within the term containing the detailed solution.
      Example: "2f" means two decimal places....
      Returns:
      BeamResult
